intro: Torilis nodosa subsp. webbii, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley, carrots, and dill, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. It has slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The flowers are small and white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, and it produces small, oval fruits that are dispersed by wind.
